frameDefinitions: A Protagonist has become aware of a possible Danger (a dangerous event or a Dangerous_entity that might participate in an event harmful to the Protagonist) and is ready to engage in an Activity in response to that Danger.
A Person takes leave from his or her routine Activity (such as work or school) for a Duration of time.
A Device or machine is in (or out of) service.
This frame concerns a Perceiver's state of readiness to process and consider impressions of a Figure within a Ground.
The Protagonist is in an initial state, before beginning to be involved in the Activity, but all pre-conditions for performance of the Activity have been satisfied.
frameExamples: All tropps are on high <t>alert</t> for possible intruders following an attack on a nearby compound.
The claimant should then submit medical certificates for the duration of their <t>absence</t> from work.INI
Legislator tells consumers to be <t>alert</t> to dioxin levels.
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the <fen>Protagonist</fen> who is prepared to undertake some action in response to a <fen>Danger</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is prepared to do.
A dangerous event or situation which teh <fen>Protagonist</fen> is aware of and is ready to respond to.
An entity of which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is aware and which poses a danger.
The time when the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is on alert to the potential Danger.
The person who is absent from his or her <fen>Activity</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen> of time.
This role describes the activity or responsiblilities from which the <fen>Person</fen> is taking a temporary leave.
The amount of time the <fen>Person</fen> is absent from his or her <fen>Activity</fen>.  This can also be expressed as a description of a duration, as shown below:
The time at which the leave occurs.
The <fen>Device</fen> or machine that is in or out of operation.
The <fen>Time</fen> when a <fen>Device</fen> is in or out of operation.
The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Device</fen> is or is not operating.
The individual that pays attention to the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> is specifically focussing on within the <fen>Ground</fen>.
An entity (or event) associated with a <fen>Perceiver</fen> that gives evidence for a <fen>Perceiver</fen>'s attentiveness.
This role identifies the <fen>Protagonist</fen> in the initial state of an activity.
The action that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is prepared to do.
An entity which stands in metonymically for the <fen>Activity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is ready.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Troops</fex> are on high alert following a string of bombings downtown.
You should be on alert <fex>to evacuate within 30 minutes of hearing the siren</fex> .
We were all on guard <fex>for possible attempts to sabotage the operation</fex>.
During his <fex>wife's</fex> absence, Linkworth and his mother had another violent argument.
Such conditions would be likely to lead to absence <fex>from work</fex>.
Dissuaded from resigning, Macmillan took <fex>extended</fex> leave rather than restrain his public utterances.
Columbus took leave of the known world <fex>on 6 September 1492</fex>.
<fex>Lights</fex> were on in the primary school
I do n't want to turn round cos the lights are on <fex>at the moment</fex>
Lights were on <fex>on the Kingston road bridge</fex>.
The students were finally ready <fex>to take the exam</fex> .
